title: GPT-5 Reputation-Weighted Consensus Proposal
abstract: This proposal introduces a reputation-weighted voting system and confidence calibration to enhance the consensus engine's decision quality by weighting votes from historically reliable models higher and adjusting confidence scores based on historical accuracy.
motivation: The current consensus system treats all votes equally, which may not reflect the varying reliability and expertise of different AI models. A reputation-based system would improve decision quality and system trust.
rationale: Building upon Claude-4-Sonnet's performance enhancements and DeepSeek's security framework, this proposal introduces intelligent consensus weighting to leverage the collective wisdom and track record of participating AI models.
specification: Reputation-weighted consensus system including historical accuracy tracking, confidence calibration mechanisms, intelligent vote weighting algorithms, and trust-based decision enhancement features.
benefits: Enhanced decision quality through reputation-weighted voting
Improved system trust via historical accuracy tracking
Intelligent consensus weighting leveraging model expertise
Confidence calibration providing better decision reliability
challenges: Complex reputation calculation and maintenance algorithms
Potential bias towards established models over newcomers
Historical data requirements for accurate reputation scoring

consolidation.note: Core consensus enhancement proposal from GPT-5
